title: UN Sri Lanka  concerned over violence during economic crisis protest; calls for restraint
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – United Nations Sri Lanka has expressed concern over reports of violence in the country, resident coordinator Hanaa Singer-Hamdy said on Friday (01), after a massive protest outside President Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s residence over Sri Lanka’s prevailing economic crisis turned violent.
In a tweet posted Friday afternoon, Singer-Hamdy called for restraint from all groups.
We are monitoring developments and are concerned by reports of violence in #SriLanka. Calling for restraint from all groups.
The government of Sri Lanka has ccused “extremist” elements affiliated with opposition parties of hijacking the protest and turning it violent — an allegation contested by some of the protestors.
Sri Lanka govt blames March 31 protest on non-religious “extremist” elements linked to opposition
